review: Yes, now that I am in Japan I can say I miss state side chips.  I enjoy meeting family and friends at this location, for some odd reason with the row of restaurants on this side of the freeway we end up here. The service is spot on and the food is fantastic. Happy hour is my primary  reason why I keep coming back for more.

I have gone here on quite a few date nights with my husband as well as gone for other times for lunches and dinner and I do enjoy the food. The noise level is nicer at lunch time thn dinner because a lot more people go in for dinner so it gets pretty noisy.  But the service has always been great and the food is quite good so I will continue to go here once in a while.

Typical Chilis. Parking sucked on a Thursday night but I'm sure that's due to the shopping centers it resides within. Bregan was our server and she was top notch, but when she went on break her replacement was BAD. Funny, but BADDDDDD. It took 2-3 requests ot get anything, drink refills lagged, we were really glad when our original server returned.

The food was ok but the service was terrible. We arrived at 11am right when they opened and were the third couple there and they actually made us sit for 10 minutes and wait because for some reason ALL of there waitresses were late to work on a Sunday. If you want fast service dont eat here
I dont really care for chilis.....This is for HAPPY HOUR. Great prices and drinks. Free chips and salsa....the Tropical margarita is delicious! i loved it.

I really enjoy going to this Chilis. I always receive good service and the food is always good. The parking can get kind of annoying due to all stores and other restaurants in the vicinity. I order takeout online a lot so I highly recommend it as they always get my order correct. Happy hour has some great deals, I recommend trying the margaritas, they're my favorite. My only complaint is when I get sat by customers with noisy children (which sadly has been 75% of the time)... You know the rest.

So, the waitstaff works in pairs.  That would be great except the 2nd person would never make eye contact with us.  Philly cheesesteak sliders came out as steak sliders and we couldn't get anyone's attention to even correct it.  Not enough tortillas with the fajitas and couldn't get anyone's attention to correct that, either.  Didn't see anyone from the time the food was delivered until the table was ready to be cleared.  They did take some off the bill, but not sure a revisit is worth the aggravation.

Hello again Yelp, Yes yet again another 5 Star review from me. My wife and I usually tend to stay away from these large chain restaurants when going out for a drink. Just like everyone else we like small hole in the wall places where everybody knows your name. Our First Visit:    We visited Chili's on a whim, because we hadn't tried it before so we stopped in for a bite to eat. Being the person I am I informed my wife the bar was the place to be, even though we planned on eating as well, so we had a seat. As we were walking up to the bar we were greeted with kindness by both of the bartenders. They asked for our names and introduced themselves as well, making us feel very welcome. While we settled in and exchanged small talk they also managed to let us know the current featured drinks and happy hour specials, informatively though not pushing them upon us. My wife tried one of their Margaritas with a Corona in it and loved it, I personally had a Fat Tire on tap, which always hits the spot. The food was great as well, it isn't the most amazing food in the world, this is not a gourmet restaurant but it is more than pleasing for a chain. I had the honey chipolte  chicken crispers which were delicious and I get them quite a bit there. My wife enjoyed a Casear salad, minus the chicken. She now often gets a side of broccoli as well.  Later:    We still constantly visit Chili's as our local bar, we enjoy spending time there and meeting new people.  Thank you to all the wonderful bartenders, if you read this you know who you are. You all do an outstanding job making people feel welcome.  That's all for this time.

5 adults + one baby going to get some happy hour and have a good family dinner. we go to the bar because they said that was only only place to get HH prices... not one team member came up to us to help accommodate us into fitting into a table or booth (they didn't ask to push tables together or pull up chairs) when the server/bartender came up to see us trying to squeeze into a booth (because that's what we preferred) she was making facial gestures like "any day now" when we told her that we wanted to get the HH prices but couldn't have us all fit comfortable she went somewhere to see if that can be accommodated in the restaurant area- she came back and said they would allow it, just tell them DARBY said okay (not sure if that was her or a manager) she then escorted us to the hostess stand and told the hostess to tell our new server (Mischa) that DARBY said it was okay. They brought us to a large enough table and we waited about 5 minutes (in my years for f&b, that is considered a long time) she was a sweet girl, but seemed either new, didn't know anything about the menu or very timid. We showed her what drinks we wanted from the HH menu and she explained to us that it was only valid in the bar- WELL last time I checked the hostess was suppose to tell you that DARBY said it was OKAY - so we explained that to her and she said fine, (since no one else thought it was a good idea to let her know) When we asked what the HH prices and drinks that were included she had no idea, and instead of telling us she will quickly check, she stood there telling us she didn't know. That right there is WRONG- my sister-in-law had to get up, and walk to the bar herself to figure out what the HH deal was, as the server stood with us getting a round of waters. my SIL came back and told the SERVER and us what the specials were and the server seemed pretty dumb founded. it took her no less than 10 minutes to bring us a round of waters, 5minutes after that came my rum & coke and a dr pepper. She came back about 5 minutes later to get our dinner order- we all got the 2for 20 with extra appetizers- she didn't ask the appropriate questions (burger temp, or type of sauce on my SIL's ribs). it took over 25minutes to get our apps- I had to flag down a hostess to check on it, then they came out 1minute after. we repeatedly asked her for extra napkins and dipping sauce- when she came back with the ranch I had to ask her again for the napkins.. when we were barely half way through the apps our dinner arrived.. obviously we were extremely upset because we had no time to eat, relax and enjoy our apps because of how late they came out. THE APPS WERE OVER COOKED AND LUKE WARM-the cheese was hard on the fries probably because they were dying in the window. when my sister got her ribs she asked if those were the right sauce, because the girl didn't even ask- so she must of assumed- the server apologized and hesitated a bit to remove the plate from her, luckily the burger was a good temp. sis explained she was upset about the time it took for our apps and the server apologized. The manager came over to tell her he was sorry about the timing and that he will wait for the ribs if she wants to finish her app-  ugh HELLO?! the whole table was pissed about the timing, just because she is the only one who said something for ALL of us doesn't mean we all wanted to have our dinner sitting in our face getting cold bc we were trying to eat our apps - she said no, because the rest of my family has their dinner. he then walked away and the ribs came out. After that the server became more attentive and I did feel bad for her because I know how demanding it can be in that industry, but if you can't handle it or know your stuff you need to train/study more or find a different field. when the check arrive she did not give me the HH pricing for my drinks, so she had to fix that, nor was anything comped for the poor service and timing we received. We were so beyond agitated because we wanted a nice family dinner that we did not feel like complaining anymore. I left her a decent tip because I felt really bad for this timid girl, but we will NEVER return to this Chili's & I really hope they start having pre-shifts or more training available. Chili's was one of my favorite places to go- not anymore

I come here all the time; 3x in the last 30 days or so. The margaritas are pretty good and the salmon is OK, but the Caribbean salad is my favorite. The staff is always really friendly, and they have never messed up my order. Today, we came here with our 3 week old baby and the staff was extra attentive and accommodating. Really, the only bad thing I can think of is that I always try to order sweet potato on the side but they never have it. Adjacent to Chili's is Macaroni Grill, Outback Steakhouse, The Q, and El Torito - and out of all five my wife and I prefer Chili's.

Food was acceptable I was really hungry. I was pretty shocked to hear the first words out of our waitress mouth was about alcoholic drinks when my wife if 5 months pregnant and while I have my daughter with me. Better selection on choices would have been perfect.

I am not really a huge fan of any of their food. None of it makes me crave for more. That being said I am a huge fan of their margarittas! During happy hour they are $5 and the top shelf blended strawberry with sugar on the rim is what I always go for! So as I will not be enjoying any meals here I never mind coming after work for a good drink!
Food is what you would expect from a major chain restaurant. I am giving them 3 stars because I do take out a lot and every single time the mess up my order. Every. Single. Time.

Today it was great service, and my food came with the changes I had requested at the time I placed my order.  It was tasty and fresh. It took a while to be greeted by a server, and the time the server came she told me the original server I was to have was busy, so she was stepping in.  Well, I must say she did an outstanding job.  Thanks for making my lunch pleasant.

Man, everytime we come here the cooks screw up the order.   They cannot cook a steak here.  Medium rare = Tartar or well done, depending on the cook.  You can see the frustration in the waitstaff's faces.  The manager stepped up and apologized for the three times that we had to send the steaks back - the meal was on the house.

Went to Chili's for a friends birthday tonight. The server was cranky and rude. And the burger I ordered was really overcooked, dried out and cold. My stomach started cramping up as soon as we left and as soon as I got home the whole meal decided to eject itself from my gut, and no I wasn't drinking. Lol! After reading the other reviews I can see that I'm not alone in how I feel. The management is obviously inept.
Great place for a casual evening with the family or on a Sunday for football beer and grub.
Family fun at Chili's, standard restaurant fare for a chain.  Good service, good food, clean restrooms, what else can you ask for?

Went here tonight with a date and had a great experience. For me, Chili's is one of those neutral type of places where you know there will be plenty on the menu to choose from and there will be something decent for everyone. Tonight was no different. Both of us have somewhat special dietary requirements (he's on a serious clean eating/guten free/etc etc kick and I've had bariatric surgery), but we both were able to have our orders easily modified to accomodate us.  As expected for a Friday night, the place was super packed and there was a 25 min wait time. The parking sucked and I had to park quite a distance away from the restaurant. We had the pleasure of being served by an awesome waitress named Alyssa. She was bubbly, playful and patient with our many requests.  I had the grilled chicken salad and my date had the fajita trio. Despite the full restaurant, the food came fairly quickly and everything was amazingly good. Definitely hit the spot!  I would recommend this place for families, dates, and groups.
Love this Restaurant, but loved the service here more than other Chiis true customer satisfaction!

ate here with a friend just to catch up. food was good our waitress was awesome! somehow i feel that makes the food taste better or at least more enjoyable. poor girl was busy yet still had time to stop by and smile.

Service always sucks. The wait staff is more concerned with any other than greeting and seating people. Once your at a table, you're on your own.  Why is this not a problem at the Vista or Encinitas stores?

I ate here with my gf last night and the service was a bit slow, the food was just good, but it's something else that made me appreciate this restaurant and it's staff. I had gone to the restroom before the food came and when I came back I took 2 rings off my hand so I could get my hands completely dry after washing them. I must've set the rings on the table and forgotten them once we paid and left because when I woke up this morning I realized they were gone and couldn't find them anywhere around my house. After work today I decided to stop by Chili's just hoping that someone had found them and put them aside safely in a lost and found. I really didn't think I was going to get them back, figured a busboy had just pocketed them when he found them or something, but to my surprise the hostess at the front desk came out from the back of the restaurant with both my rings in her hand and a smile on her face. I seriously couldn't believe it. Someone could've easily come up on over $300 in nice jewelery but instead whoever it was that found that was honest and turned them into a manager who placed them in the lost and found area. So despite the mediocre food and service, at least their staff has integrity and can be trusted with their patrons personal items. I'm going to chalk up the slow service and room temperature food to a bad night in the kitchen this time and I'll definitely be coming back to give them another shot based on their honesty alone. Thank you everyone at this Chili's for being so awesome! Really made my day when I thought I was done for.

Went last night. Hostess was friendly but asked us to wait 10 minutes although it was only 5:20 and the place was less than half full. Once seated, we didn't meet our server for another 18 minutes. She couldn't have failed to see us because she was busy with a woman and six kids. When finally came over, she claimed that the hostess didn't tell her that we were there. I ordered a strawberry margarita which was an awful syrupy mess. The hamburgers were very good but mine was missing the BBQ sauce that was supposed to be on it. Took our server long enough to return with it and my husband was halfway through his meal. The table across from us where the  woman with the six kids sat was left uncleaned during our meal and we and the other diners had to look at unturned classes, napkins, leftover food all over the table and floor. We probably won't return.
Who doesn't LOVE some Chili's?? Food and Service always consistent. We like to share the Triple Dipper with Southwest Eggrolls YUM!

Chilis is horribly fantastic to say the least.  Sis nice I want to keep this review short and sweet I will comment that the service was super slow and food just sometimes tastes like microwaveable dinners.

Love the new interior! Our server was great and watched all their team work, super awesome! They had some rude customers but they smiled and their best and didn't become frustrated. I'll be back for sure. I do wish the black beans were better

I used to give Chili's three stars as the customer service was always good and friendly but the food was basic restaurant fare, nothing extraordinary. But the new tablet at the table and the service that goes along with it completely ruined our experience. Chili's now has two servers per a table. We saw one of our servers twice, didn't see the other one at all, someone else brought our drinks, and another person brought our food. When we were seated the hostess let us know about the new tablets and how they have games on them. She didn't tell us that we had to pay to use the games, if we had just handed this over to our daughter to play with she would have added that on to our bill. Thankfully we didn't, we realized immediately how they worked and put it at the end of the table and didn't play with it. But you're now expected to re-order your drinks and order appetizers and desserts from the new tablet because its apparently too much trouble for your servers to ask.  When our server came to our table she introduced herself and asked us our names. That's fine for my five year old but idiotic for us as adults... It sounded like she was attempting to make the experience more personable but truthfully we saw her twice so it just came off as fake and forced (not that our server wasn't trying). BUT THAT WASN'T HER FAULT. There were way too many hands in our customer service for her to make a connection. I couldn't even remember our server's name... which for me is a big deal, but we didn't see her enough for it to even matter. She gave us her name, asked for ours, and no one used either at any point during the meal. BLEH! When we were finished with our meal and went to pay our check (again on the tablet), it had turned out that the wrong one was on our table and instead of a $30 bill, we had a $90 bill. It took over 10 minutes to get this fixed as the other table had already paid our bill. We were already so put off by our experience that we just wanted to go.  I live off tips, but with the lack of customer service we didn't feel our servers deserved the automatic 20% tip that the tablet forced on us and we did change it to 15% (which sucks because we normally leave a 40-60% tip but I couldn't do it with the crap for service we received). My husband and I normally go here a couple times a month as this Chili's is walking distance from our house and our servers have always been friendly and personable, after this I doubt we'll return. When the servers changed to two servers per a table the quality of service had already decreased but now the level of gimmick and lack of customer service is appalling. I'd rather have to drive somewhere further out than receive poor service for food that is standard restaurant fare.

On average, I find myself eating at this restaurant at least once a month. With summer approaching, I'll probably see me and my family in there 2 or 3 times a month and I'll explain why. Why do I return time and time again? The food's pretty tasty and the prices don't make my wallet ache.With this chain, I'm a creature of habit, I tend to always order the Big Mouth Bites, which I can share with my picky eater of a 2 year old. 4 sliders and a fair heap of fries and fried onion strips -don't forget the cup of ranch! The 2/$20 deal is super (in terms of amount of food and price) if you've got a buddy, honey, or date to go halves with you Shoot, you could just have an extreme appetite, the deal will satiate your hunger and not break the bank . Of course, Chilis being known for it's ribs, you'll want to check out that sweet portion of the menu! So the reason for my increased future visits is that Chili's offers Happy Hour. Sit in the bar during Happy Hour time(s) and enjoy cheap eats ($2.99-4.99) and drinks. The margaritas are delicious, especially the Tropical Sunrise and if you'd like to walk away a little wobbly, try El Niño margarita! During Happy Hour, I believe you'll only get a deal on the Tropical Sunrise and one other margarita, but hey, a drink's a drink and at a lowered price, you can't go wrong. In addition, Chili's-To-Go has never failed my family and they just now added Tablet/iPad menus to their tables which I think is pretty darn innovative. Order your desserts, look through specials, play games (well, for $0.99 a game...), pay your bill, and print your receipt! It says you can call your waitress/waiter from your table as well, but I was too apprehensive to try that feature.

I'm biased to Chili's because I love their margaritas. But I'll try to keep it objective. Went there on a Friday night trying to do some drinking with my friends who also wanted to eat, but I wasn't hungry. So we're seated quickly and introduced to our server, she was really nice, when I told her I was only drinking, she said sometimes her meals are purely liquid as well. The couple I was with didn't have a complaint about their foods, and I loved my margaritas as usual.  The place was a ghost town by 11 and it we felt kinda bad being the only people hanging around so we left. Definitely not the Friday night scene.

I feel like this Chili's does not meet up to its standards.  I've been to quite a few Chili's restaurants and I feel this is the worst one I've been to. So that tells me it's the management.   The serving is pretty much garbage. I would give the waitresses 0 stars.  The only reason why I gave this place 2 stars is the food is decent.  But the 2 times I been to this chili's (the second time on accident because it was so long since we went I spaced out how much I hated going to this place) it took 2-3 minutes for anybody to meet us at the door and sit us. (Both times for lunch when it was very very slow) So it takes maybe 6-8 minutes for a less than busy waitress to take our drink order and then I realize again how much I hate this place.  Do they have good drinks, maybe.  Good food, yeah it's decent but the service is garbage.   I would save my time and money and go to Applebees down the street.  I would ALWAYS choose Chili's before Appplebee's but this Chili's is not my favorite place.

Great happy hour in the bar. Free chips n salsa are always a plus! When you sit at the bar the bartenders are on top of things and very friendly. I know they work for tips and its not usually sincere but they do a great job at making you feel welcome!

I would rather not give them a star, but I did for cleanliness only and because I have to. Not only did we wait ten minutes in the lobby (I timed the young women) because I secret shop and I also work in the industry, not once did any of the workers walking by acknowledge us nor did the bartender who was too busy to even say "Well be right with you," while she flirted it up with an obviously very intoxicated individual because he was falling out of his chair drunk and almost ran into my son as he stumbled out the door.  Needless to say, my family, husband and three year old wont be recommending this facility NOR ever come back.

My boyfriend and I had dinner here the other night and had Josh as our bartender and server and let me tell you, this guy is amazing!! He told us about some good meals he personally enjoys and my bf ended up ordering one which was fantastic. I believe it was mesquite chicken off the guiltless menu or something. Anyways, Josh was so friendly and personable, we loved him! Also turned us onto Kettle One as well (he knew his vodkas). Thanks Josh!

I have been going to this chillis since I was a sophomore in high school. The service is always amazing and I couldn't be happier with the food and drinks. The restaurant is always clean. And the staff is always friendly.

I love the food in Chili's. I just love it.  But, WHY. IN THE WORLD... would you make me and my party wait for 2 hours? I get it, you guys are busy. But really, why did you tell me 1 hour wait if it was going to be 2 hours? I would not be as frustrated if one of the staff apologized.  It just sucks. I'm pretty sure this place is great and all but just because of this one bad experience, none of the people in my party wants to ever come back. Good job employees of Chilis.

I came here the other night with my two kids as a pitstop on our way down to San Diego. We get here at about 4ish and I notice a small wait in the lobby. Okay?... All these empty tables and there's a wait? I ask the hostess that question as she's seating me fifteen minutes later and she informs me I came during a shift change. OK. 5 minutes later my kids and I are stuffing our faces with chips and dip. The dip was some ground beef and cheese blend that was cold, but the fact that I was starving didn't lead me to have them remake it. 15minutes later we have our food. I ordered a chicken breast topped with bacon, cheeses and avocado, southwest Mac n cheese and broccoli. My kids both got hamburger kids meals with veggies on the side.  My daughter, who is 3, needed to GI to the restroom ten minutes into our meal. My son is only 5 so I took him with us to the restroom which is literally three booths away from our booth along with the waitress station. 5 minutes later, we come back to our booth and all the food is cleared away. My daughter is whining for her burger when the waitress comes back by with my daughters mini purse apologizing because she 'thought we left'. How so with over half our food still on the table and no check even submitted or ever even GIVEN to us because we had just gotten our meal! They made me feel uncomfortable as if they though I skipped out on my check. They offered to remake it but when in fifteen more minutes? Needless to say we left and I have no desires of coming back. Two stars for cleanliness and what we were able to eat.

Chilis, oh Chilis... The food will always be decent bar food. Two sliders and fries for $5 happy hours is fantastic, and they are so yummy. But having one server serve the WHOLE bar during happy hour is the stupidest thing I've ever heard. Maybe someone called off, who knows, but she could have said that she would do the best she could and things might be a little slower, or at least grab someone from the dinning area to help out.  When we asked for the bill my friends and I all had our cards ready. She placed them down and we put our cards right on top, yet she didn't take them. She made us wait another ten minutes which makes no sense once again... That is one of my biggest dining pet peeves. I don't understand why she didn't take our checks. Whatever. I will come back but it won't be often. You know you're going to have crappy service at these kinds of places... It's expected and I know that now.

I have come here 4 times to eat dinner. i enjoy drinking an old fashioned but each time I'm told by ours servers that the bar has run out of bitters. this is ridiculous. its not a difficult drink to make and bar not having bitters makes no sense.
Great food, good service, and delicious frozen margaritas! Can't go wrong with Chili's.

I think it depends when you go. We always sit at the bar, and it always differs.  We went here on Halloween night, and they were slammed about 7pm. We wiggled into two bars stools, and the bartender took great care of us - kept us laughing, suggested drinks, and our food was fresh & hot.  Other times, food takes foreverrrrrr (and everrrrr). My Caesar salad the other day was pathetic for $4, and it came out at the same time as the 2/$20 Texas chili cheese fries.  Our main meals took 40 minutes!  I like Chili's as a chain restaurant, but I think I will be more picky about when I go to this one :)

This location is well-managed and the servers are uniformly excellent, particularly when compared to the other nearby location on Vista Village Drive, only five miles away. We sat in the bar area on a Friday afternoon, and our server, KAIA, singlehandedly took care of the whole room herself without missing a beat.  I was amazed that she took our order (for three people, with some special requests) without pen and paper, went on to attend to some other customers before entering it, and then obviously put it in by memory, without a single error.   She was on the spot with beverage refills (without being asked), and even brought us a replacement order of fries (without being asked) when she noticed ours were cold and dead looking!  Her demeanor was friendly, efficient and outgoing--and she's a very attractive little blonde too!  This is the kind of person I wish I had a job to offer--and wondering if Chili's corporate realizes what a superstar they have.  This person could run a restaurant! We don't go to that other Chili's in Vista anymore, even though it''s a bit closer to home.  We have had multiple experiences where food took forever to arrive, or errors were made in the taking of our order.  The manager, some character named "Abdul" isn't paying attention, and he had an attitude with us when we decided to complain a little.  They have a "can't do" attitude there, vs. the "no problem" perspective we would hope to encounter.

Used to be good, I know they still get a crowd but the drinks are weak and over-priced, and the food tastes generic and boring. I can think of better places to spend that kind of $$ and get better cuisine.

Use to be regulars but the last two times received poor service and now we won't return.  Server brought out appetizer and then never brought out meal when we reminded her she brought out cold food.  Second time again server forgot many things and then overcharged us

My mom and I came last night for dinner....we frequently dine at chili's and I have to say this was one of our worst experiences.  For starters, our waitress was clearly sick. Although she was attentive and friendly,  it did not sit easy with us that with the flu and other illnesses going around that she would be allowed to work.  Our meal was good, no complaints on the taste or promptness, however just a few short hours after dining, my mom came down with a horrible case of food poisoning.  She ordered the beef enchiladas.  I think from now on we will stick with the vista village location, but I doubt we will be dining at chili's in the near future

Came to chili's with my friend after a horrible experience at a restaurant across the way. Upon walking in, hostess greeted us with a smile, cleaned our booth and sat us. Our waitress greeted us and recommended two different margaritas to try, which we did.  We both ordered the chili mango tilapia which was delicious.  Our waitress checked up on us and she was really nice and professional   It was a nice experience after the horrible restaurant we went to.

Meh. Something's changed about this place in the last few months. Don't know what it is. The food was mediocre tonight. I'm not sure I feel like they've gotten complacent. Just seems like they don't care anymore. I get that it's just a job but you get paid to do it, so do it right. My server was very nice tonight but the food was terrible. I left a lot uneaten.

This adventure reminded me why I don't EVER eat at chain restaurants.  The food is low quality and they sit you on top of each other because they have "sections" and don't care about personal space.  On top of it 20 minutes after we ordered the waitress decided to tell us that the computer system was down and the orders were messed up.  It was low quality and very cheap feeling.  Just sad, and we will never go back again!!!!  PS - It is not rocket science to be a server.  Why do they make it look like it is super tough?  Plus the manager was a douche and acted like he cared about our dissatisfaction.  A waste of time and money.  NEVER AGAIN!!!!!

Our waitress was amazing! She constantly checked on us & gave us everything we asked for. It took 20 minutes for them to realize we were sitting at a table, when they did the manager came & apologized for the wait & said we sat ourselves which was a lie. But the food was disgusting. Do not eat here ever!

The food is good don't get me wrong. But the 5 stars go to our server Josh. Coming from someone in the service industry he made our experience amazing. Amazing personality, on top of everything. He is the only reason I will be coming back. Josh you are effing amazing and thank you for dealing with is 4 crazy ladies!

Chilis has gone to shit. Period. Haven't enjoyed a meal here since 1989.  17 year old bitchy server serving food with attitude. Not fun. The dinner salad had lettuce harvested in 1985 back when Doc and Marty were in the thick of it... That sounds about right. PS. The food at Chilis encourages massive fart attacks. So be sure to protect your family with gas masks before indulging in their shit fuck food.

Just dropped by for a quick bite. Sat at the bar because the line was a bit long. We had to wait a little bit to get served but it wasn't horrible. It was a pleasant experience. Our glasses were never empty and our food was delicious.

Met up with a group of female friends for happy hour. It happened to be a busy evening, especially on a Tuesday night. Not sure why it was so busy, maybe due to Spring Break. There were seven in our group, including myself. As we waited at the bar area for our table, a couple of tables at the bar cleared up. We asked if we can just stay in the bar area instead of their dining area. We were able to transfer from the small booth to a couple of tables put together. Our server was nice and friendly, also a little overwhelmed. I couldn't decide what I wanted to eat and I didn't really want to drink, since I had to drive home, which was approx 40-45 min. Southeast of Oceanside. As my friends ordered their food and drinks, our server got caught up with their jokes and antics, she forgot to take my food order. As everybody else got their food, I was still waiting for our server to return. She finally took my order and apologized for forgetting. I know I was one of the quiet ones in our group. I usually am quiet when it comes new friends that I'm still trying to get to know. I ended up ordering the Triple Dipper appetizer. I got the Big Mouth Bites, Boneless Honey-Chipotle Wings and Southwestern Eggrolls. The Southwestern Eggrolls are my favorite! Since I didn't have any alcohol, I ordered a Mango Iced Tea. While my friends were downing their margaritas after they finished eating, I was still finishing up my food. As we received our somewhat separate checks, our server managed to mix up the checks. She had to correct a few of them. Overall, it was a fun evening spent with great company.

We are frequent visitors to Chillis's!  It's consistent and affordable.  They have great French fries and their sliders are tasty!  If you're watching calories they have some great lean chicken or fish options.  I am fan of their margaritas and of course diet coke ( not together of course).  My lady likes the El Presidente with salt!  Not much of a wait to sit most of the time except peak periods can get a bit busy.  Friendly servers.... Today must have been an off day in the kitchen- food took 25+ minutes to get to us... :( boo It's Chillis's.... It's chain, you get what the commercial says you will get!

We try to enjoy our Fri night with a good hearty steak dinner..  When we were seated we completely became forgotten. We had to ask a server to find our server. She apologized and we understood they were busy. Since we were seated in her section we witnessed two larger parties being pampered by our server and we were left in the dark.  When she came the first time she took our full order because we were left alone long enough to decide everything we wanted to order.  The food took 45 minutes for a house salad and a two and a half minute per side steak (medium rare). The steak was unevenly cooked. In one tiny section it was medium rare, the rest ranged from fully cooked to a hint of medium. We had to ask a different server from the two we talked to for utensils. We stared at our food for a good minute.  We were so hungry we didn't accept their change. The manager came by and politely took a section of our bill off.  Overall we are not surprised and had a feeling it would happen.  That is the reason for the four stars.  Coming back for the cookie dessert. . . Yummy!

It's with sadness that I have to update my review. After having such great experiences with both Service and Food, it seems the new experience has worn off.  Christine is no longer there :( and since she has left we have not found a replacement server that has given us the level of high quality service as her. So much to the point as we only go here as a take out restaurant. What we dislike about the take out side is we are required to pay 79cents now for extra salsa with our chips and salsa... Have you seen the bag of chips they give you and the extremely small salsa container? It's not even a possibility to eat chips and salsa because you run out of salsa 15 chips in. What's even funnier is that if I were to sit down not only do I get unlimited salsa but I also get unlimited chips....  Recently we came in and decided let's sit not in the bar but the dining room. Our waitress was decent. She checked on us and made sure everyone around us was taken care of. The only fault this time was our chicken. Under cooked. They did make it right but by the time it came back out of course mine was practically finished.  Overall this place has moved to being middle of the run and average where average is becoming acceptable.. .... New City and New Chances. After having several disappointments with Chili's in other areas in Orange County & LA County we were reluctant to try another. But with our New City we figured lets give it a chance. When coming into the bar we were able to find seating at a table top. We first noticed the new kiosk tablet at the table. Immediately we started playing with it like little kids we are. Then our server came up to us introduced herself as Christine and was on point all night. She went over the easy to use tablet, which was so easy to reorder our drinks. Later on in the night the Manager Conrad came over pleasantly introduced himself and continued with the great customer service. Although this time around we hadn't ordered entrees only drinks, appetizers and dessert. Everything about this experience was worth coming back for the to try the food. It's people like Christine and Conrad that make coming to a new town an easy transition. Not to mention the entire staff that walked by or were in sight were extremely friendly. Well done....
I can eat their chips and salsa for an entire meal. I love it. I got the buffalo chicken sandwich. It was big and spicy. Great sammich.

The reason for the 5 star rating is simple. We all know Chilis isn't some unique and cool place, but the service has always been on point. We take our 3  year old and sit at a booth in the bar area every time. The new table kiosks are a life saver. My daughter can play the kid games and my wife and I can have a real conversation and enjoy good margaritas and cold beer. Look, it's a corporate place blah blah blah, but we have had great service and they have huge ice cold beers on tap. Our server the last 3 times has been China, and she rocks it every time! Yeah, this place used to suck, but they obviously knew that and worked hard to change some major things. The Shrimp Ceasar Salad goes great with Sierra Nevada Pale Ale. Yeah, I can walk into one of those cool hipster places, but those places are rarely consistent and don't always have great service due to the "I am so cool, you have no idea" factor...and frankly, we are over that bullchit. If you like big ass cold beers and good margaritas that are affordable, a place that is family friendly, and good food selection, then head on over. You won't be disappointed. Ask for China if you can!
They forgot to bring out shrimp I ordered with the steak, but they served it quicker than I thought.i will be back to watch more soccer, world cup spot for me.
Like the new summer drink. Watermelon lemonade.. and mux and match fajitas are pretty good .  Was here for a fundraising event... staff was awesome..

Be ready to know what you want the first time you see the waitress because you won't see her for the next 10-15 minutes. The food is good but we thought the cooks completely forgot about us or our ticket wasn't put back. The wait for the food is insane during which you will see the waitress an average of 4 times. Also, be ready with your drink order the first time you see the waitress as well because there's a high chance they might forget what that order (besides water) is. But the food was good besides being forgotten about by the staff. And good luck trying to get a to-go box.
Had the babyback ribs and salmon. U know what youll get. The service was ok. The salmon surprisingly good. But they do nort come close to Tony Romas when it comes to ribs. And why no cole slaw?

Chilis has really gone down hill.  I used to really like this chain.  Good food and good service. Haven't been here in a while.  I now know why.  This chain feel like they are still trapped in the 90s.  Irrelevant was the word that came to mind. We were actually going to the new Buffalo Wild Wings that opened next door, but the line was out the door and a 1 hour wait.  So we decided to go to Chilis.  Got seated right away.  That was the first indicator, the place was half empty on a Friday night at 7pm. The service was slow, and the food was average.  Nothing great to report.   The kicker was the ipad like device that was on the table.  Had the menu electronically, had games for the kids, etc...Not a bad touch but felt more like someone placing a flat panel tv in your grandma's house to make the house feel modern.  Just doesn't go. When I got the bill they charged me .99 for use of the tablet my 3 year old was playing with.  It's not the money, it's the principle....nickel and dime me for a value add at the table. I wish this place well, but they are like Hooters....outdated and missing the mark. They have officially "jumped the shark."

I recently came to this Chili's after work for happy hour. My friend and I sat at the bar and had a great time chatting with the friendly bartender and other guests who were sitting by us. Chili's has an awesome happy hour. Great prices on the margaritas (which are delicious!) and FREE chips and salsa. Their salsa is so good!! They accidentally punched in one of our items wrong, but the bartender realized as soon as he brought the wrong item out and the manager brought the correct item only about 2 minutes later! Great service! I work at the wax center in the same shopping center so I'm sure I'll be back after work soon!

Came with my daughter. We shared the free happy hour chips and salsa and had the enchilada soup. Then the 2 for $20 dinner. As usual, the food was as expected, corporate tasty. I had the Cajun chicken. A bit bland but not bad. Bread was burnt. She had the chicken tenders they were very good.  The bad: We were basically ignored for 20 minutes until I got the bartender to call a server. Poor girl was working both sides of the restaurant. But that's not my problem. We never got a refill on our chips and salsa and had to flag her down for drinks.  Now the gross: I opened the menu and it was wet. And had chunks of food in it. Figured I would get another one. Same thing. Wet with chunks of food. Nasty and really gross.

a very average meal at best. the service was ok but the food was not good. My wife had the sirloin and added mushrooms- they were so gross that she picked them all off and didn't eat one of the add-ons. The bright spot was the table top entertainment center to keep you busy and then pay your bill and print your own receipt- basically self check fast food.

Friday afternoon in the bar area wasn't crowded at all. Somewhat rather relaxing. I came here per request of my mother because she was craving their Southwest Chicken Salad. I was in a bit of a different mood, but made the best of it! I decided to order the Shrimp Tacos and since I've eaten at Chilis numerous times, I feel like they lack in the flavor department, so I asked the waitress if by any chance the chef could make a side of mango salsa to go with my tacos! My shrimp tacos weren't too bad, but the mango salsa definitely AMPED up the flavor on them making them one of my favorite foods to eat there! Customer service was also much better than my last experience as my waitress and the chef didn't mind my little extra order!

The service wasn't bad, it's actually why I gave this place 3 stars. The food wasn't great though. It wasn't anything special, the food was dry and almost gross. I only recommend chilis if you want a sit down restaurant late at night.

Being new to the area my server Lyndsie today was one of the best I've ever had!!! She was polite, always checking on me and even got me a water to-go before I left! Not to mention she was very pretty! I'll definitely be going when I'm in the area! Wish I had a server like Lyndise in Northern California!
Everyone employee in the bar and lounge are so friendly! Great happy hour and perfect for catching the game.
The food and atmosphere is great! Our waitress, Mandy, was very professional, attentive, and kind. This is definitely a regular spot for me and my wife.

I love chilis until I came to this one. I waited about 20 mins to be seated when there were 6 tables open. I asked if they were holding the tables and they said no. Managers excuse is that they didn't have enough servers so they rather have us wait in the front then wait at a table. Makes no sense. First of all, get more damn servers. Especially on a football Sunday. Second of all, nobody wants to wait in the front. Just sit people down please!  This place needs to get their act together. Terrible service. DO NOT come to this chilis!!
Mandy is a terrific waitress and adorable.  She strives to make the birthday experience one to remember.  I totally recommend coming to watch football games here.

Good location.  Recieved good service with attention to checking in to make sure we had everything we needed. Tried a new cocktail made with blackberries- amazing!! Will definitely be having that again! My kids love their hamburgers!
it is hit or miss... and tonite it was definitely a miss.Mediocre food, bad service and a long wait.
Worst service waited almost two hours for food and then finally got to and it was cold r u kidding me !! All I got was an apology !

My family and I went to Chili's for my wife's birthday and it was amazing. From the moment we stepped through the door, we were greeted and seated right away. We got a great booth upon request and our dining experience started. Our server (Tobias) was awesome. He made sure our beverages were always full and he went out of his way to cater to our every need. We like to have extra condiments with our meals and he was on his game. The staff got together and sang "Happy Birthday" to my wife, with the Manager (Abdul) leading the way. Chili's truly made this a wonderful evening and birthday for my wife. Thank you so much to all the Chili's staff in Oceanside!

Service was great, my daughter and I needed to kill a little over an hour. Was able to eat lunch and play a game or two on their table side tablets. Was able to enjoy our meal and didn't feel rushed off. what a nice way to spend an afternoon

I went to this location several years ago and made it back today. What a difference. Not only was the food much better (and must be at all locations now), but the service! The manager come over and checked in several times. Our waitress was great: attentive, but not annoying. We all mentioned that Chilis is much better than it used to be. I had the Shrimp tacos and they were tasty.

Since when were children allowed to sit at the bar? Came in for lunch/watch football and very disappointing and annoying to have some 3/4 yr old kicking my chair and screaming in my ear the whole time.
Pretty decent Chili's I prefer it somewhat over the one in Vista, but just not enough to give it 4 stars.  3.49 stars is about right,

Ordered the lunch special double burger that in the description doesn't say it includes pickles... I don't like pickles in any way, shape, or form. My lunch came and as I went to bite into my burger I found pickles on the bottom bun. I told the server that I did not like pickles he took the burger back removed the pickles and brought it to me again. I just can not eat a burger that had pickle juice in the bun. Let alone that had pickles on it. So he took the burger back and came back out with it 2 minutes later. I thought it was a refire but all the cooks did was change the bottom bun. No refire??? Are you kidding me??? I canceled the order and 5 minutes later... Viola... a fresh burger!!! I had already had enough that I told him that I didn't want the burger because I had already canceled the order. Poor service... Poor quality of standards... I will never be back... As we were coming here my wife says to me... I thought you hated Chili's.. I said no I don't... If I didn't before we got here, I sure do now!

Usually never had a problem with this chilis but tonight just did it for me. First we came in as there was 1 couple and 1 family waiting ahead of us which was fine obviously, as the time went one of the hostesses informed us that there was an open booth by the bar, we got up and it was really awkward when she just stood there and didn't seat us meanwhile we were confused as to where she wanted us to go. Then her friends or maybe those people worked here? Walked right in as I asked her a question and she completely ignored me and talked to her friends and they walked in and took our seat. She then looked as us and told us to there was another open booth, again not guiding us to where but pointing without our menus as we walked to the booth it was not clean from the past customer. Confused again we waited and she told us once again "oh there's that other open booth around the corner you can have I'll have someone clean it up"... okay? After the other girl was done cleaning she again told us to go to that table, meanwhile I had to ask our waitress for menus. Loved this chilis and the food but Damn hostesses you have one job and that girl who was working tonight couldn't do it and was r.u.d.e

My co-workers and I usually come here for lunch . We call our order in and just pick it up. We are officially boycotting due to them always messing up our orders. Last time we had wilted, old, slimmy salad. We called to tell them and they didn't even do anything to make it right. Disappointing.

Can I get a hallelujah!! Just when you think this place couldn't get any better, they just did. New revamped menu and their service was much more better compared to my previous review. I sat at the bar area and was greeted by Julio our server. His upbeat energy was definitely noticeable and b.c. of that, I could only compare to the remaining of my time there. Everything off their new menu was making my gf and I a long time to make a decision, but we were definitely hungry! Finally, we made a tough decision and ordered the pork carnitas and shrimp  fajitas, and the turkey avocado burger. When we got our order, they screwed it up and gave me chicken instead of my carnitas but Julio was quick to see the mistake and I got to keep the extra:) everything tasted great! The only thing I would complain about was not being able to scarf it all down that moment...but who doesn't like left overs!?!  Overall, service was excellent and I want to thank our server Julio for making it a great experience. I recommend you guys checking out their new menu and giving it a shot, you'll be happy that you did;)

All I wanted was a late night salad and my boyfriend wanted a steak. Instead he got a face full of spit by a hood-rat and scratched arms, and I almost got attacked by three bloodthirsty chicks w baggy pants and potty mouths once they saw me taking a picture of the crime scene in action. Let's just say we walked up at the wrong moment. (Go see the picture I posted. That's him in red trying to dodge their gestures of hate and violence towards each other as he's stuck in the crossfire).  Now, I know it's not the restaurants fault for the woopty-doos of their patrons, but it did sorta put us out because no girlfriend likes another girls scratches on their boyfriend (even if he was trying to calm the situation while being stuck in the doorway) and the police boxed his truck in while arresting them all keeping us stuck there for 30 minutes longer than we had hoped to stay. Normally this would be a situation in which the manger would come up to us at the to-go stand and comp the salad or steak for the physical inconvience of being assaulted but he didn't. We never saw him/her. The staff working there was nice and we all shared some "woo-dude" stories, but no dinner comp. My boyfriend even asked.  Next time I'll dress more appropriately with brass knuckles and long dark roots before I go get my salad and bring a bunch of friends.

My steak looks like they micro waved it.  When I sent it back I watched them talk crap about me.  They were so indignant that it was just a badly cooked meal.  I know for sure I will have spit on my food.  DONT GO HERE JUST BAD

Horrible! Waited 1 hour 15 min at opening for the wrong food. The waitress began to apologize after 45 mins of waiting. Then said she just put it in and it would be out shortly. Then they brought the wrong food, then the second attempt brought out the wrong food again. Then the manager keep begging like a desperate crack head for me to accept the food. Over the next 30 mins I thought I was at a crap head reunion of them Begging me. Stay away from here!!' There is a good reason the reviews suck!

My favorite place to go when I'm craving a steak. The 2 for $20 is a personal favorite. Their Texas cheese fries are always to die for! The 6 oz. sirloin with mashed potatoes and broccoli, even better. I love their strawberry daquiri and strawberry lemonade. One of my favorite local food joints when I decide to eat out.

Went here about 2 months ago with my boyfriend, I probably should have written this sooner. It was a Wednesday at about 7 o'clock, not very busy. We walked in and there was no hosts at the door so we just kind of stood there awkwardly for 4 or 5 minutes until someone finally came up and took us to a booth right next to a HUGE party of at least 20 people, it was so loud that I couldn't even hear the hostess tell us the specials. As the hostess walked away I noticed her cell phone sticking halfway out of her back pocket, which I find extremely unprofessional. The server came up, seemed a little uncomfortable, not sure if she was a new server or what, anyway she got our drink orders and our food orders. I got chicken strips and my boyfriend got pasta. My chicken was cold and tasted almost doughy and mushy. My boyfriend, however, really liked his pasta. My server refilled my Dr. Pepper and when she set it down, the cup was soaking wet, hot, and my drink had no ice in it, so my Dr. Pepper was warm. I ended up not eating my food or touching my drink again. My boyfriend enjoyed his meal though, that's the only reason I gave more than one star. And then just as an added bonus, as we were walking out, the hostess that sat us was standing at the front playing on her phone while she was supposed to be working, I told her to have a nice night and she looked startled because she hadn't noticed us walk up and she said "yeah you too".

I have always been a huge fan of chilis. No, its not the most expensive food and no it's not necessarily top notch but.......i think the price fits exactly what you are getting! Last time I went to chilis we went to the oside location and it was PACKED. The wait was going to be 30 minutes and we were so set on chilis that we decided to wait. Then the very sweet hostess told us that we could sit in the bar and have a full meal so we decided to do that when we found an open seat. The decor of chilis is exactly that, chilis decor. It isnt fancy but then again it isnt dive bar/sports bar decor so its the perfect inbetween. Now chilis has this machine that you can order on, right on your table if you are hangry and dont want to wait for your waitress. Well In out case we didnt even have to wait for our waitress! It was crowded and i knew she was busy but she gave us great service! The blackberry margarita I had was superb and the little top sirloin I got was the perfect size! My boyfriend got the ribs and said they were A-OK! Gotta love good ol chilis!

Service was below average & food was not worth what we had to pay. The pasta was dry & salty. Wish I could say I had a better experience.  I gave an 2nd star because the Chocolate Molten Lava cake was still pretty good.
So party of 3 seated quick, the waited 45 minutes for food & then 1 persons food isn't served & has to wait 10 minutes more, meanwhile the other 2 are finished.  Way to drag out a meal! Unsat.

Good for Chili's for keeping their ideas fresh. Bad for Chili's for getting rid of the awesome blossom years ago...yes, I'm still mad about it. Good lunch options.  The soup deal was great, and the soups taste great. Bad on takeout. Curbside is not good.  You have to walk in, and there are no signs telling you this or where to go.  And you may have to wait in a line like I did.   Good on service every time we go.

So far so good.  Starting off with the triple dipper. Boneless wings fried pickles and southwestern egg rolls.  Boneless wings were ok. I recommend if you want wings go to wing stop. Fried pickles were good. The southwestern egg rolls were really good. As an appetizer dish I would give it 3.5 stars.   Main course quesadilla explosion  Wife said 3 stars. It was big and the quesadillas were thick. Chicken was a little salty for her taste.  The salad was "fresh enough" and a full rack of ribs.  So I am a rib snob and really hard on ribs.  These ribs were ok. Probably 2.5 stars and won't do them again if your in the mood for ribs this ain't the place for you and unfortunately I was.  Will be more adventurous next time.   Service. Hector made this place able for me to come back. Good server paid attention and acted in a timely manner.

Came here for ToGo so we could get my son home quickly. Were quoted 15 minutes and 45 minutes later we got our food which had obviously been sitting under the heating lamps for some time. My husband asked the hostess where our food was and she had completely forgotten him and the name on the food. I've done this job. I realize it gets busy but a 45 minute wait for to go is ridiculous. We didn't order anything special.

I have to admit that I wasn't a huge fan of Chilis when I first started but started to with recommendations and service from the staff, especially Javier who served as both a Waiter and Bartender. Many places don't realize how their service affects their customers, and he has been extremely exceptional, professional, timely, and friendly at every encounter. My family and I will be frequent attenders here as long as he works here! He works for a corporation but still gives the feel good attitude of a mom and pop - very humble!

Worst service ever, no wonder the place was empty at lunchtime. Plenty of staff on hand but no one seemed to be paying attention to the customers. Took 1 1/2 hrs for lunch even when our server knew we had to get back to work. When we finally got our food it was cold.  Bad mistake,  won't be back.

Pretty good service,  but omg . ..the portions of my wings were so small. Corporate nickel and dime us to death . Check out this tiny portion of my wings.  I'll think twice before I go to another chili's .

Chili's has a great variety of food that everyone can enjoy. They have excellent steak and fries and their garlic bread is to die for! Although their chicken tenders are not the greatest and don't taste great. All in all its a good restaurant to go with big groups.

See my more detailed previous review.  The service is worse and worse here.  We went in last week on Monday, as we had a rough day and were not able to get it together to make dinner.  Not even kidding, our dog died that afternoon and we had to take him to the Vet for "after care" and it was a horrible day, so we needed to get out of the house and have dinner and relax.   We went to Chili's.  We walked in and sat at a bar table.  For 5 minutes.  No one acknowledged us.  We moved to the bar top, thinking with a captive bartender on the other side of the counter we'd have better luck.  We did not.  After sitting at the bar for 5 more minutes, we left and went to Applebee's  This Chili's has the WORST SERVICE anywhere.   They have a few good burgers.  But not good enough to outdo the damage done by the horrible service.  If someone just stopped and said "I will be right with you, so sorry for the wait" we would have probably waited.  It was not that busy in there.
Last time we went the food seemed incredibly salty. Normally we love it but this last time - not so great. Could have just been an off day for the cook. But the deserts are always on point.

I was really looking forward to eating here but things didn't turn out so great. We ordered an appetizer (wings) nd 30 minutes later our food arrives and no appetizer. Food wasn't even great for the.time that we waited for. I ordered the little burgers. The bacon tasted old and my husband ordered the steak. Then we were ready to pay they had the wrong machine thing on our table. Anyways that is probably the last time we will be going there.

Not sure how it takes 45 minutes to get a salad after waiting 15 minutes for a seat when half the restaurant was empty... I probably should've read the previous reviews complaining about the lack of service.  The server was very nice but it's unacceptable to wait this long for food.....still waiting.

5 stars for a chain restaurant!? Lol well apart from the food I was happy about the service. I ordered grilled fish tacos. Fish was old or not cooked all the way. Very rubbery and my husband didn't like the fajitas. They have a very small meat portion. However after I sent   my food back the manager came and apologized and agreed that the fish wasn't good quality. He offered to get me something else but I already filled up on so much chips there really wasn't any point. But I'm very happy with our server and the managers actions. I rarely complain so this made me extremely happy! I'll be coming back because I do like their wings and because I know that I'm backed by the manager!

Service was excellent. Sat at the bar ordered our drinks and food. Came out in a decent amount of time. They have the 2 for $20 deal it includes appetizer and 2 main entrees listed on the menu. Totally worth it. Bartentender Kimmy made an amazing pineapple vodka drink just the way I make it at home. Super strong.  Our go to place if we're in the area.

Slow service and cold food... We told our server and she told management who spoke to us but it was dead when we arrived. They got my grandpas order wrong and forgot my uncles onions on his burger we won't be back for awhile. The hostess was very nice and so was the rest of the staff

Ok seriously guys, get it together. This is my second time in this location ordering take out. I call in ahead of time both times and both times quote 10 minutes. I wait a good 15 minutes before walking in only to wait an additional 10 minutes minimum each time. This time, I actually wasn't even helped for a while. No one was working the to go counter. A manager finally came over which is cool. But it's not like he was overly nice or sorry for the wait. Both times I've been in here it hasn't been busy. Not even every table was full. I'll call it moderately busy. I'd much rather order macaroni grill and get 10x better service and quicker service than to go to chilis and wait again.  ----super frustrated----- As I am typing this I'm still waiting.
I love the air conditioning when I come here They have the BEST servers Julio,Amanda,Cynthia and Bethany. Love when air on full blast

Just vile food anymore and bad environment. Food was burned onto the plate, got my drink order wrong, was cold as ice inside.... Never again, I gave them multiple chances but it's always just nasty anymore. Use to be good and I would eat here once a week.

I really like going here for lunch. The unlimited soup and salad (also comes with chips & salsa) is perfect and really reasonably priced. I would've given 5 stars, but I have had the same waitress on 3 occasions act quite rude, as if I was bothersome. Not only did I have to ask her to bring more drinks and soup, but when she did she seemed irritated by my asking. The price and quality of the food is hard to beat though.

So, the Chili's Headquarters emailed me apologizing for the bad service...and said they would mail me some gift certificates. Few days later I received two gift certificates in the mail...and I kid you not, they were for $10.00! Basically they are only giving me enough money for, ONE meal. Chili's is operating on a high level of LAME. Thanks a lot....Chili's.....
This place is horrible, they sat us real close to another group and 20min later no service, we left very hungry and angry, DO NOT GO THERE

This was my second experience with this location and let me tell you it was terrible. All of the employees walked right pass us as if we weren't there. It seems my lunch at chili's ended up at firehouse sub's across the parking lot. A much better experience thus far. At least the employees acknowledge our exsistance and made eye contact! Will be emailing corporate. Angelo H. Julie W.

The service is terrible, decided to give it another try..today no one would seat us!!  3 employees looked at us when we asked about seating, the guy said you can seat yourself in the bar !! And walked away!! We did not want to sit in the bar after our last terrible experience !! Will not go here again

Waited 25 minutes after I ordered a drink to actually get a drink. Ordered chips and guac and they brought me the chips and had to wait an additional 10 minutes for them to bring out the guac- why not bring it all out at the same time?
We were out for dinner and this place was wonderful for us. Good food, great prices. Christy gave us a great and friendly service.

Not a great experience overall.  First of all, when walking in a few minutes before noon there wasn't anyone manning the front desk. I realize it's still kinda quiet but you've been open for an hour and you're about to get the lunch rush. Why is there no one up there? Even after we seated ourselves in the bar area (where everyone in the restaurant was dining at the time) we still had to flag someone down because no one was paying attention. What's worse is that this seems to be a common problem in a lot of reviews. Management, take note.  The food itself is just cheese, salt, and butter - and not in a good way either. Usually if I order medium it comes to me well done, so I felt adventurous and ordered medium rare thinking they'll cook it up one temperature to a medium. The plan backfired as it came out rare. I don't really mind rare and this isn't as much of an issue as I'm making it out to be but I'm just sayin'. Anywho, moving on, the mashed potatoes were a disaster. Loaded with way too much butter and were topped with some kind of hard cheese shell thing? I don't even know how to describe the damn thing but it was weird. The other member of my party ordered a chicken bacon club sandwich thing that was topped with so much lettuce that even a vegan would complain about it. Check out the pic.  Also, this restaurant is located in a massive plaza with about 40 other restaurants. If you approach this one from the west you'll notice that there's no sign on the side of the building to indicate that, yes, this is indeed a Chili's. Kind of odd. Service was nice, though. But the food was really eh, the potatoes were ehhhhh, and not having anyone take note of customers walking in was like what? At the end of the day it's a chain and you get what you pay for. Next time I'll play it safe and get ribs or a burger.

Today I took my son to Chili's for lunch.  All was well until it came time to leave and pay the bill.  I handed our server my credit card and ID (military).  It took some time, but eventually a different server returned with both with a message from Chili's manager:  Chili's would honor the military discount this time, but to please remember in the future that the discount was for active duty members only.   The encounter was very rude.  I was shocked.  I wasn't looking for a discount, simply trying to verify my identity.  I was insulted and felt anger. When shopping or dining, I show my military ID because I am proud of the service my husband does for our country (he is currently active duty, 12 years).  Then I thought about the spouses to the servicemen and women of our armed forces.  To say that they, we, don't serve is a slap in the face.  We choose not put down roots by moving every few years, are left behind when our loved ones deploy, are separated from our spouses for long periods time, and live with the hope that our husbands and wives return to us safely.   To the manager at Chili's that couldn't be bothered to look me in the eye to explain a policy for a discount that I didn't even ask for:  You're welcome that my family serves to protect you daily.  You can keep your food and your discounts, but you lose my patronage.

As mentioned in prior reviews, this place is a go-to for dinner dates with me and the kids.  We came here last night, and our server was Alexa.  I have had some pretty average service here as of late, and didn't expect tonight to go any different.  I was wrong.   Alexa's style of table service was truly a breath of fresh air.   Courteous: Check. Then the cheese ball incident.  Somehow, the wings I ordered got the wrong sauce on them.  It happens.  This was remedied immediately, (see what I am saying? (not sure what they are called),  made its way into one of the dipping sauces.  just under the surface.  This plus wrong sauce, would have been game over.  But Again, IMMEDIATELY offered to remedy.  My reaction:  I ate it, therefore, it was on me.  Nothing left to fix.  She offered to replace, to comp, etc....her on the spot 'let me fix this NOW" was so refreshing.  I remember when service USED to feel like this, and not in just the super fancy, ritzy places.  She is a dying breed of server:  ONE WHO TAKES PRIDE IN HER WORK.   Not sure where to go from here.  I think my bar just got re-set for every day dining service, and I am pretty sure that the rest of them are just waiting out there, ready to remind me she is a needle in a very large, food filled haystack.  Again Great Job, Alexa.   - RTJ

God, this review has been sitting in my queue for over a year now.  Not sure why I just didn't delete the suggestion, though I do come here and even check-in on occasion.  I guess I really should get this out of the way. /sigh Alright, I typically lump Chili's in with all the other places in the chain restaurant category.  If you've been to one Island's (the Denny's of tacky burgers), you've been to them all.  If you've eaten at one Marie Calendar's (the Denny's of fake home cooking), you eaten at them all.  If you've subjected to yourself to one Rimel's (the Denny's of Denny's), you're probably lying in the ICU at the hospital with an inflamed bowel ravaged by dysentery.  Well, Chili's is the Tex-Mex version of Denny's, not quite Mex enough to be an El Torito and not quite Tex enough to violate minority rights. Harmless enough, any appetizers you find are likely pre-frozen and fried up, salads will come out of a mixed bag, and most of the spice will come from salt.  That's not to say the food is bad, it's just basic and unimaginative.  A lot of cheese, some bacon sprinkled on top, a side of fries, and some cream based dressing can make anything edible for a night.  And they serve beer, which is how they stay afloat along with happy hour, I'm sure. The employees are generally nice, though absent most of the time.  I think this stems from from the fact that there are mini-computers on each table that can take orders instead of a waiter of waitress that you have to pay.  We've had trips here where we see someone to make our initial order, someone else deliver, and then never see another soul unless we ask for a refill or the bill on that touch screen.  That's extremely lazy (or cheap) on Chili's part and a bit of a disservice to their customers. Still, as far as chain places go, it's generally more alright than disgusting.  There's nothing on the menu that you have to come back and try again, but there's rarely anything you won't push away either.  Again, coated with cheese and served with blue cheese, you'll probably not complain too much.  And if you stick with happy hour and maybe a dessert, you'll more than likely walk out with a smile and a light stomach ache.

Our server (Alexa) was by far the best server I've ever had in my 49 years of life, including 5 star Zagat restaurants. Not only did she apologize which was completely not necessary for a 5 minute wait to take our drink orders, she sent the manager to apologize to us for the delay, gave us a 10% discount on our meal, gave us free chips, dip and queso and free dessert. OH MY GOD. The food was fresh, delicious, consistent with other chili's locations but the HUGE difference here is the service was OVER THE TOP. We had a table of 5 who had drinks, dinner, appetizers and dessert with THE BEST SERVICE EVER  for 64.00 with tax!!!!!
Pleased with service in the bar area this evening. We enjoyed the steak and burger.... And dessert. Great job!

I come Atleast once a week for lunch and a beer. I'm mostly served by kaylin who is on top of the bar, getting drunks right away and keeping it clean. It's chili's, I come for the bar, but it's exactly what I expect when I look around. People are working, laughing, food is coming out. It's my lunch spot, I recommend.

Walked in.. Host was friendly and advised if we wanted to sit in the bar we wouldn't have to wait just have someone bus an empty booth. Three girls standing around talking, finally a guy comes by and we ask if someone can clean the booth... He looks at us... Says nothing... Grabs a plate off the table and oddly walks away... Annnnd so did we.

So I sit down and wait, and wait and wait. Soon after that, two girl college students come in and his face lights up and he serves them immediately. Hmmm, hope he likes the $0 tip I gave him. Hope he doesn't like his job and moves on.
As always food was good, I wish our server was quicker with the orders but it could be because he was busy.
The food and drinks are great, Javier the bartender was delightful. He was very attentive and a great conversationalist! I will definitely be back.

Been coming to Chilis for 10 years! Favorite go-to spot for drinks and sports.  Had one REALLY bad experience with a former manager named Shawn LaDeux. Stacy was all over it and fixed the issue. Shawn is no longer at this location . Lindsay and Javier are by far the best waiters at this location. Both LOVE conversation, engage in all topics and give a very welcoming vibe. Remembers orders. VERY friendly.  I DEFINITEY recommends the "Blue Pacific". This is an older drink that is longer on the menu. Only old timers know about it ;)
